text: The pot-au-feu is as much a national institution in France as is tea drinking among ourselves and it is prepared at least once a week in every bourgeois household. Thackeray, of course, waxed enthusiastic about Bouillabaisse and sang -This Bouillabaisse a noble dish is,A sort of soup, or broth, or brewA hotch-potch of all sorts of fishes That Greenwich never could outdo; Green herbs, red peppers, mussels, saffronSoles, onions, garlic, roach and dace. The "pot-au-feu" is as much a national institution in France as is tea drinking ameng ourselves and it is prepared at least once a wtek in every bourgeois household.Thackerayf coursewaxed enthusiastic about Bowllabaisse and sang-This Bouillabaisse a noble dish isA sort  oupor broth or Bew A hotch-potch of ell sorts af fishes That Creenwich nerer could outdoj Gren herbstd peppersmssels seffrnSotesonionsgalc,roach and dace.
